channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Most Americans don’t matter to the economy like they used to
A golf course manager says his business could lose $500,000 a year if daylight saving time goes away
item.description: Golf has deep roots in the history of daylight saving time, which begins for most states at 2 a.m. Sunday when clocks “spring forward” by one hour.

item.title: Thinking of buying the stock-market dip? Here’s what you should know.
What’s your VO2 max? The most important health metric you’re probably not aware of shows how fit you really are
item.description: VO2 max is one of the best indicators of your cardiovascular fitness—do you know yours?

item.title: ‘America First’ policies are threatening American exceptionalism as the economy and markets flash warning signs
item.description: "We are still betting on the resilience of consumers and the economy. However, Trump Turmoil 2.0 is significantly testing the resilience of both."

item.title: DoorDash’s stock pops on S&P 500 nod. Here’s who else is joining the index.
Stocks end higher on Powell remarks, but S&P 500 still posts worst week of 2025
Lebron James and Silicon Valley’s elite use hyperbaric oxygen therapy to stall aging and inflammation. Here’s what it’s all about
item.description: The treatment is increasingly popping up among longevity chasing biohackers and at spas and wellness centers.

item.title: Social Security to increase overpayment withholdings to 100% from 10%
The pastor leading the Target DEI boycott says the company is turning its back on Black consumers—and there are more protests to come
item.description: Over 130,000 people have signed up to participate so far.
